Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Hi. Want to install barterdex on Arch Linux. Following the instructions, I started with installing komodo from git.

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Compiling fails despite having installed all dependencies.

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Any help would be greatly appreciated! üòÉ

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: post the console output

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: which branch you were trying to install? from which repo?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
are you planning on using native mode?
if you want to use SPV mode without downloading blockchain data, you don't need to use komodo binaries

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: I mainly need it to do atomic swaps between BTC/ZEC. ZEC is running in full mode already.

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Will I need to run BTC client?

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: I think just the wallet seeds are enough for swaps, right?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you want to perform only BTC/ZEC swap, you don't need komodo wallet

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you need BTC and ZEC wallet

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Okay, didn't know. I was following this guide: https://wiki.komodoplatform.com/wiki/How_To_Install_BarterDEX_on_Linux

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Do I need to run native BTC wallet on the system? (i.e. download entire blockchain?)

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/barterDEX/install-barterDEX-CLI.html

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: use electrum mode if you don't want to download blockchain data

Author: tkh23#4477
Content: Okay. Thanks for the fast help brother. I will try that way üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont think ZEC will work now due to their recently changed new txformat

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: idiot question, if i send coins to the resulting p2sh address of a `6a` (OP_RETURN) script, are they then locked? how would i come up with the PK for such an address anyways?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: opreturn coins are burned

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: ok, so basically bJj83uBV4WXQLqyCdH841bzjW84JwQexnK would be a valid burn address, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not necessarily

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is possible for some redeemscript to end up with that address

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: ok. what if i used `0 1 OP_EQUALVERIFY`

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: instead of OP_RETURN

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: and no i dont wanna burn my coins, i'm just trying to understand this üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to be able to spend the coins, you need to satisfy the spend script

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for p2sh address, additionally you need to know the redeemscript

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: that much i understood. the script hash and the 'data to satisfy the script' so it evals to true

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: now... how can 0 == 1 ever be true

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that one cant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the coins are effectively burned

Author: 0x03#8822
Content:
```# komodo-cli decodescript 0100010188
{
  "asm": "0 1 OP_EQUALVERIFY",
  "type": "nonstandard",
  "p2sh": "bKgMfAkubvXjgm5NbMpYPDDWQXBnRX5esK"
}
```

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: amirite

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if it is a p2sh address you wont necessarily know the redeemscript

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: ic. now how would i come up with that

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: thats not something thats documented a lot or i'm just completely unable to find the info

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is meant to be a secret until the first spend

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you can spend to a p2sh address and not let anybody else know what its all about

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you just need to have the redeemscript somehow, any method

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: ic. but even if i had the script for the 0 1 OP_EQUALVERIFY it then wouldn't help me a lot. true?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in this case, since it is an unspendable script, it would be difficult to spend

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: because i could use the address but couldn't send off the coins.

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: very much appreciated your explanations, thanks a lot.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the only way to be able to spend it would be to do a hardfork that creates some special rule to allow spending a 0 1 EQUALVERIFY and likely that wont be too well received

Author: luke#8628
Content:
I am having trouble getting BarterDex to show my balance for HODLC even after I've successfully enabled it. I definitely have a HODL balance, and marketmaker has successfully connected to the coin. Anyone else run into this?

Screenshots (2 images): https://imgur.com/a/0ukirXM

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: HODL & HODLC are different

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: do you have HODLC balance at the same address that barterDEX is using?

Author: luke#8628
Content: hmm... let me check

Author: luke#8628
Content: You're absolutely correct, I just wasn't looking at the right address. https://imgur.com/xM72UNA . Thank you! Follow up question... is there a way to tell barterDEX to use this other address instead so that it shows a balance when I run the "balances" command?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you need to use the private key or passphrase or the address you want to use

Author: luke#8628
Content: oh, I see. there was a gap in my understanding. I needed to first send the coins to the barterDex smart address for HODLC. I can see that value now, thanks!
